page.title: 01WEST NOTTINGHAM
page.content: This area is slightly to the west of Central Nottingham. Once, the area consisted of the separate villages of{ {Radford, Basford & Wollaton,}but now, these areas have all been incorporated into the{City of Nottingham.} The dominant building of the area is {Wollaton Hall,}set in a large deer park and built in Elizabethan times. The hall is now a {Natural History {Museum}and is a popular attraction for {tourists.} The largest employer in the area is{ {'T.I. Raleigh',}cycle manufacturers, with its large factory in{Radford.} Another large firm is the{Shipstones {Brewery'}in{Basford.} The area is{largely residential.}The buildings in the{east}are now being demolished and the area re-developed whilst the{western}estates were not developed until the 1920's.
